docs.snippet: The architect of the Great Society wasn’t anything like the current president. But a new book suggests that their times, not their talents, tell the real story....
docs.lead_paragraph: The architect of the Great Society wasn’t anything like the current president. But a new book suggests that their times, not their talents, tell the real story.
docs.abstract: Frank Bruni Op-Ed column describes how Julian Zelizer book The Fierce Urgency of Now, which focuses on Pres Lyndon B Johnson's tenure, has caused him to reassess criticisms of Pres Barack Obama, particularly in way he has dealt with Congress; notes book shows how rare it is for presidents to impose their will on Congress, and that Johnson's reputation for manipulating Congress has been blown out of proportion.

headline.seo: Barack Obama, Lyndon Johnson and Presidential Comparisons

docs.snippet: Rising cybercrime is roiling and reshaping today’s world before we’ve learned to adjust. How does anyone adapt?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rising cybercrime is roiling and reshaping today’s world before we’ve learned to adjust. How does anyone adapt?
docs.abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column describes his conversation with Dov Seidman, CEO of LRN and author of book How, which makes case that world has been dramatically reshaped by information technology; notes that Seidman suggests that deepening and strengthening connections that have already been formed is best way forward, even in light of recent hacking scandals, so that everyone is connected through healthy interdependencies.

docs.snippet: SHARP--John Eugene, of Bronxville, NY on January 5, 2014. Devoted husband of his loving wife Joan. Beloved son of the late Maria Guarnica Bennett. John was born in Colon, R.P. He spent his childhood in Panama and the idyllic island of San Andres a...
docs.lead_paragraph: SHARP--John Eugene, of Bronxville, NY on January 5, 2014. Devoted husband of his loving wife Joan. Beloved son of the late Maria Guarnica Bennett. John was born in Colon, R.P. He spent his childhood in Panama and the idyllic island of San Andres and was brought as a teen to the United States by his beloved uncle Edward Platz to live with him, his wife, Guillermina, and their cherished family in Connecticut. John earned his U.S. citizenship in the Army during the Korean War. He studied physics and comparative literature at Columbia University and fell in love with New York City where he lived the rest of his life. A serious collector of books, music and art, both natural and man-made, John's library exceeded 40,000 books. He was also an accomplished, award winning photographer. John had an insatiable interest in, and knowledge of, literature, music, art and the sciences ... a true "Renaissance Man." Hired by IBM as one of their early technicians for the first commercial computer, John worked for IBM in various capacities for 36 years. A renowned IBM instructor, John loved teaching and was consistently praised by his students as their "best teacher ever." He could make any subject interesting, and fascinated friends and family with erudite, off the cuff lectures on almost any topic requested. John loved travel and exploring the culture and natural beauty of the U.S., Europe, Africa, the Far East and Latin America. But he enjoyed most being with friends and family. Generous and caring, John was beloved by all who knew him. He was without doubt Shakespeare's"prince among men." He will be sorely missed. Viewing at Noon, memorial service at 1pm on Thursday, January 8th at the Fred H. McGrath & Son, Funeral Home, 20 Cedar St., Bronxville, NY. Donations may be made in John's memory to: Lewy Body Dementia Association, 912 KillianHill Road SW, LilburnGA 30047. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SHARP, JOHN EUGENE

docs.snippet: MERKATZ--Neil Howard, 50, beloved husband of Lynda for 15 years died on January 3rd, 2015 in Stuart, Florida. He was born in Chinon, France during the time his father served in the military. As a young boy living in Shaker Heights, OH he became an...
docs.lead_paragraph: MERKATZ--Neil Howard, 50, beloved husband of Lynda for 15 years died on January 3rd, 2015 in Stuart, Florida. He was born in Chinon, France during the time his father served in the military. As a young boy living in Shaker Heights, OH he became an Eagle Scout and later graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and Cornell Medical School. He was a triathelete, climber of Colorado's "Fourteeners" while completing residency and fellowship training in child and adolescent psychiatry at the University of Colorado Medical College. He went on to practice in Martin County, FL. and became Medical Director of Sandy Pines Hospital where he was beloved by the children and adolescents for whom he cared. Neil was a happy, fun loving guy, an animal lover, avid sports fan, and scholarly reader of fantasy literature, but treasured family above all. He will be profoundly missed by his wife Lynda and their daughter Jessie and by his parents Ruth and Irwin Merkatz of Rye, NY, his brothers Kenneth (Sheri Caplan) and Andrew (Lisa) and his four nieces and nephews who loved their Uncle Neil. Services are Friday, January 9, 2015, 11:00am at Central Synagogue in Manhattan; memorial service in Florida at a later date. Tribute gifts to honor Neil's memory and his 35 year struggle with juvenile diabetes to the Neil H Merkatz MD Memorial Fund at the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF.org). 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MERKATZ, NEIL HOWARD
